title: Legacy theorems using obsolete axioms
content: These theorems were mostly intended to study properties of the older axiom schemes and are not useful outside of this section. They should not be used outside of this section. They may be deleted when they are deemed to no longer be of interest.

blocks.name: ax5ALT
blocks.content: Axiom to quantify a variable over a formula in which it does not occur. Axiom C5 in [Megill] p. 444 (p. 11 of the preprint). Also appears as Axiom B6 (p. 75) of system S2 of [Tarski] p. 77 and Axiom C5-1 of [Monk2] p. 113. (This theorem simply repeats ~ ax-5 so that we can include the following note, which applies only to the obsolete axiomatization.) This axiom is _logically_ redundant in the (logically complete) predicate calculus axiom system consisting of ~ ax-gen , ~ ax-c4 , ~ ax-c5 , ~ ax-11 , ~ ax-c7 , ~ ax-7 , ~ ax-c9 , ~ ax-c10 , ~ ax-c11 , ~ ax-8 , ~ ax-9 , ~ ax-c14 , ~ ax-c15 , and ~ ax-c16 : in that system, we can derive any instance of ~ ax-5 not containing wff variables by induction on formula length, using ~ ax5eq and ~ ax5el for the basis together with ~ hbn , ~ hbal , and ~ hbim . However, if we omit this axiom, our development would be quite inconvenient since we could work only with specific instances of wffs containing no wff variables - this axiom introduces the concept of a setvar variable not occurring in a wff (as opposed to just two setvar variables being distinct). (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-2017.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

blocks.name: sps-o
blocks.content: Generalization of antecedent. (Contributed by NM, 5-Jan-1993.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hbequid
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for ` x = x ` . This theorem tells us that any variable, including ` x ` , is effectively not free in ` x = x ` , even though ` x ` is technically free according to the traditional definition of free variable. (The proof does not use ~ ax-c10 .) (Contributed by NM, 13-Jan-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 23-Mar-2014.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: nfequid-o
blocks.content: Bound-variable hypothesis builder for ` x = x ` . This theorem tells us that any variable, including ` x ` , is effectively not free in ` x = x ` , even though ` x ` is technically free according to the traditional definition of free variable. (The proof uses only ~ ax-4 , ~ ax-7 , ~ ax-c9 , and ~ ax-gen . This shows that this can be proved without ~ ax6 , even though the theorem ~ equid cannot be. A shorter proof using ~ ax6 is obtainable from ~ equid and ~ hbth .) Remark added 2-Dec-2015 NM: This proof does implicitly use ~ ax6v , which is used for the derivation of ~ axc9 , unless we consider ~ ax-c9 the starting axiom rather than ~ ax-13 . (Contributed by NM, 13-Jan-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Oct-2016.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axc5c711
blocks.content: Proof of a single axiom that can replace ~ ax-c5 , ~ ax-c7 , and ~ ax-11 in a subsystem that includes these axioms plus ~ ax-c4 and ~ ax-gen (and propositional calculus). See ~ axc5c711toc5 , ~ axc5c711toc7 , and ~ axc5c711to11 for the rederivation of those axioms. This theorem extends the idea in Scott Fenton's ~ axc5c7 . (Contributed by NM, 18-Nov-2006.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm axc5c711(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s0, w0)), w0)
} = {
  ja(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s0, w0), w0)
  nsyl4(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), w0, wal(s1, w0))
  ax-c5(s1, w0)
  3syl(wn(wal(s1, w0)), wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s1, wn(wal(s1, w0))), wal(s1, wal(s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))))
  ax10fromc7(s1, w0)
  alimi(s1, wn(wal(s1, w0)), wal(s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))
  con1i(wal(s1, w0), wal(s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))
  ax-c7(s0, wal(s1, w0))
  ax-11(s1, s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))
  ax-c5(s0, w0)
}

blocks.name: axc5c711toc5
blocks.content: Rederivation of ~ ax-c5 from ~ axc5c711 . Only propositional calculus is used by the rederivation. (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2006.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

The use of ~ alimi (which uses ~ ax-c5 ) is allowed since we have already proved ~ axc5c711toc5 . (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2006.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axc5c711to11
blocks.content: Rederivation of ~ ax-11 from ~ axc5c711 . Note that ~ ax-c7 and ~ ax-11 are not used by the rederivation. The use of ~ alimi (which uses ~ ax-c5 ) is allowed since we have already proved ~ axc5c711toc5 . (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2006.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm axc5c711to11(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
} = {
  syl(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)), wal(s1, wn(wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))))
  con4i(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)), wal(s1, wn(wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))))
  axc5c711toc7(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))
  alimi(s1, wn(wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s0, w0))
  nsyl4(wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))), wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))))))
  alimi(s0, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))), w0)
  syl(wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))), w0, wi(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s0, w0)))
  pm2.21(wal(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0))))), wal(s0, w0))
  axc5c711(s0, s1, w0)
  axc5c711toc7(s0, wal(s1, wn(wal(s0, wal(s1, w0)))))
}

blocks.name: axc11nfromc11
blocks.content: Rederivation of ~ ax-c11n from original version ~ ax-c11 . See theorem ~ axc11 for the derivation of ~ ax-c11 from ~ ax-c11n . This theorem should not be referenced in any proof. Instead, use ~ ax-c11n above so that uses of ~ ax-c11n can be more easily identified, or use ~ aecom-o when this form is needed for studies involving ~ ax-c11 and omitting ~ ax-5 . (Contributed by NM, 16-May-2008.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hbnae-o
blocks.content: All variables are effectively bound in a distinct variable specifier. Lemma L19 in [Megill] p. 446 (p. 14 of the preprint). Version of ~ hbnae using ~ ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 13-May-1993.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: dvelimf-o
blocks.content: Proof of ~ dvelimh that uses ~ ax-c11 but not ~ ax-c15 , ~ ax-c11n , or ~ ax-12 . Version of ~ dvelimh using ~ ax-c11 instead of ~ axc11 . (Contributed by NM, 12-Nov-2002.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dvelimf-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(w0, wal(s0, w0)))
  -| wi(w1, wal(s0, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wal(s2, w0))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(w1, w0))
} = {
  3imtr3g(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), w0, wal(s0, w0), wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))))
  pm2.61i(wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  a1d(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)))))
  syl5(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2))), wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))), wal(s2, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))))
  hba1-o(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))
  aecoms-o(s0, s2, wi(wal(s2, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)))))
  ax-c11(s2, s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)))
  ex(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), wal(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)))))
  hbald(s2, s0, wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1))
  hban(s2, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  hbnae-o(s0, s2, s2)
  hbnae-o(s0, s1, s2)
  hbimd(s0, wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)
  hban(s0, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  hbnae-o(s0, s2, s0)
  hbnae-o(s0, s1, s0)
  imp(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  ax-c9(s0, s2, s1)
  a1i(wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wi(w1, wal(s0, w1)))
  albii(s0, wal(s2, wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), w1)), w0)
  equsalh(s2, s1, w1, w0)
}

blocks.name: dral2-o
blocks.content: Formula-building lemma for use with the Distinctor Reduction Theorem. Part of Theorem 9.4 of [Megill] p. 448 (p. 16 of preprint). Version of ~ dral2 using ~ ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 27-Feb-2005.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: aev-o
blocks.content: A "distinctor elimination" lemma with no restrictions on variables in the consequent, proved without using ~ ax-c16 . Version of ~ aev using ~ ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 8-Nov-2006.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 21-Jun-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm aev-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s2, wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  alrimih(s2, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)))
  hbae-o(s0, s1, s2)
  3syl(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wal(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wal(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s4))))
  alrimih(hs0, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  hbae-o(s0, s1, hs0)
  spimvw(s0, hs0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  ax7(s0, hs0, s1)
  3syl(wal(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wal(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s4))), wal(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wal(s4, wceq(cv(s4), cv(hs1))))
  axc4i-o(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  aecoms-o(hs0, s1, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  spimvw(s1, hs1, wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  syl6(wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))
  ax7(s1, hs1, hs0)
  equcomi(hs1, hs0)
  alrimih(s4, wal(hs0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(s4), cv(hs1)))
  hbae-o(hs0, hs1, s4)
  spimvw(hs0, s4, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(s4), cv(hs1)))
  ax7(hs0, s4, hs1)
  aecom-o(s4, hs1)
  spimvw(hs1, s3, wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s4)), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)))
  ax7(hs1, s3, s4)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s4)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(s4), cv(hs1)))
  diff.hs1.s(s3)
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm aev-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ⊢ (∀(s0, s0 = s1)→ ∀(s2, s3 = s4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  alrimih(s2, ∀(s0, s0 = s1), s3 = s4)
  hbae-o(s0, s1, s2)
  3syl(∀(s0, s0 = s1), s3 = s4, ∀(hs0, hs0 = s1), ∀(hs1, hs1 = s4))
  alrimih(hs0, ∀(s0, s0 = s1), hs0 = s1)
  hbae-o(s0, s1, hs0)
  spimvw(s0, hs0, s0 = s1, hs0 = s1)
  ax7(s0, hs0, s1)
  3syl(∀(hs0, hs0 = s1), ∀(hs1, hs1 = s4), ∀(hs0, hs0 = hs1), ∀(s4, s4 = hs1))
  axc4i-o(hs0, hs0 = s1, hs0 = hs1)
  aecoms-o(hs0, s1, hs0 = hs1)
  spimvw(s1, hs1, s1 = hs0, hs0 = hs1)
  syl6(s1 = hs1, s1 = hs0, hs0 = hs1, hs1 = hs0)
  ax7(s1, hs1, hs0)
  equcomi(hs1, hs0)
  alrimih(s4, ∀(hs0, hs0 = hs1), s4 = hs1)
  hbae-o(hs0, hs1, s4)
  spimvw(hs0, s4, hs0 = hs1, s4 = hs1)
  ax7(hs0, s4, hs1)
  aecom-o(s4, hs1)
  spimvw(hs1, s3, hs1 = s4, s3 = s4)
  ax7(hs1, s3, s4)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, hs0, hs1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s4)
  diff.hs0.w(s4 = hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s3)
  diff.hs1.w(s3 = s4)
}

blocks.name: ax5eq
blocks.content: Theorem to add distinct quantifier to atomic formula. (This theorem demonstrates the induction basis for ~ ax-5 considered as a metatheorem. Do not use it for later proofs - use ~ ax-5 instead, to avoid reference to the redundant axiom ~ ax-c16 .) (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-1993.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: dveeq2-o
blocks.content: Quantifier introduction when one pair of variables is distinct. Version of ~ dveeq2 using ~ ax-c15 . (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2002.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dveeq2-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
} = {
  dvelimf-o(s0, s1, hs0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  ax-5(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(hs0)))
  ax-5(hs0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  equequ2(hs0, s1, s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm dveeq2-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  ⊢ (¬ ∀(s0, s0 = s1)→(s2 = s1 → ∀(s0, s2 = s1)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
} = {
  dvelimf-o(s0, s1, hs0, s2 = s1, s2 = hs0)
  ax-5(s0, s2 = hs0)
  ax-5(hs0, s2 = s1)
  equequ2(hs0, s1, s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, s2, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(s2 = s1)
}

blocks.name: axc16g-o
blocks.content: A generalization of axiom ~ ax-c16 . Version of ~ axc16g using ~ ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-1993.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: dveeq1-o
blocks.content: Quantifier introduction when one pair of variables is distinct. Version of ~ dveeq1 using ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 2-Jan-2002.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dveeq1-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
} = {
  dvelimf-o(s0, s1, hs0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  ax-5(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  ax-5(hs0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))
  equequ1(hs0, s1, s2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)))

  diff.wal.s(s3, s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  diff.wi.s(s3, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(wal(s2, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, w0)))))
  diff.wi.s(s3, wal(s2, w0), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, w0))))
  diff.wal.s(s3, s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, w0)))
  diff.wi.s(s3, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wal(s2, w0))
  diff.wceq.s(s3, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s3, s0)

  diffss.ex(s3, s1)
  diff.wal.s(s3, s2, w0)

}

blocks.name: ax12v2-o
blocks.content: Rederivation of ~ ax-c15 from ~ ax12v (without using ~ ax-c15 or the full ~ ax-12 ). Thus, the hypothesis ( ~ ax12v ) provides an alternate axiom that can be used in place of ~ ax-c15 . See also ~ axc15 . (Contributed by NM, 2-Feb-2007.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm ax12v2-o(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  mpi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))), wex(s2, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  ax6ev(s2, s1)
  exlimdv(s2, wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))))
  ex(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))))
  mpbii(wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0)))))
  imbi12d(wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wi(w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0))))
  adantl(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  imbi2d(wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0)), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  syl(wa(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wb(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0)), wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  imp(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))))
  dveeq2-o(s0, s1, s2)
  albid(s0, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1))), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0))
  nfa1-o(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)))
  sps-o(s0, wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wb(wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0), wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s2)), w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  equequ2(s2, s1, s0)
  diff.wn.s(s2, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  diff.wal.s(s2, s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))

  diff.wi.s(s2, w0, wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)))

blocks.name: ax12a2-o
blocks.content: Derive ~ ax-c15 from a hypothesis in the form of ~ ax-12 , without using ~ ax-12 or ~ ax-c15 . The hypothesis is weaker than ~ ax-12 , with ` z ` both distinct from ` x ` and not occurring in ` ph ` . Thus, the hypothesis provides an alternate axiom that can be used in place of ~ ax-12 , if we also have ~ ax-c11 , which this proof uses. As theorem ~ ax12 shows, the distinct variable conditions are optional. An open problem is whether we can derive this with ~ ax-c11n instead of ~ ax-c11 . (Contributed by NM, 2-Feb-2007.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: axc11-o
blocks.content: Show that ~ ax-c11 can be derived from ~ ax-c11n and ~ ax-12 . An open problem is whether this theorem can be derived from ~ ax-c11n and the others when ~ ax-12 is replaced with ~ ax-c15 or ~ ax12v . See theorem ~ axc11nfromc11 for the rederivation of ~ ax-c11n from ~ axc11 . Normally, ~ axc11 should be used rather than ~ ax-c11 or ~ axc11-o , except by theorems specifically studying the latter's properties. (Contributed by NM, 16-May-2008.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: fsumshftd
blocks.content: Index shift of a finite sum with a weaker "implicit substitution" hypothesis than ~ fsumshft . The proof demonstrates how this can be derived starting from from ~ fsumshft . (Contributed by NM, 1-Nov-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm fsumshftd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, co(c0, cfz, c1), c2), csu(s1, co(co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3)), c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cz))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(c2, cc))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), co(cv(s1), cmin, c3))), wceq(c2, c4))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  syl5eq(csu(s0, co(c0, cfz, c1), c2), csu(s1, co(co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3)), c4), csu(hs0, co(c0, cfz, c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2)), w0)
  cbvsumi(s0, hs0, co(c0, cfz, c1), c2, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2))
  nfcv(hs0, c2)
  eqtrd(csu(hs0, co(c0, cfz, c1), csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2)), csu(s1, co(co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3)), c4), csu(s1, co(co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3)), csb(s0, co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2)), w0)
  fsumshft(hs0, s1, c0, c1, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), c3, csb(s0, co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2), w0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), cc)), wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(c2, cc)))
  nfim(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), cc))
  nfv(s0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1))))
  nfel1(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), cc)
  nfcsb1v(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(c2, cc), wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1))), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), cc))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), w0, wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cfz, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1)))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, co(c0, cfz, c1))
  eleq1d(c2, cc, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  csbeq1a(s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  csbeq1(s0, cv(hs0), co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2)
  sumeq2sdv(s1, co(co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3)), csb(s0, co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2), c4, w0)
  csbied(s0, co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2, c4, universe, w0)
  ovexd(cv(s1), cmin, c3, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cfz, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(csb(s0, co(cv(s1), cmin, c3), c2))
  diff.csb.s(s1, s0, cv(hs0), c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, w0, wcel(cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), co(c0, cfz, c1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cfz, c1)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s1, co(c0, caddc, c3), cfz, co(c1, caddc, c3))
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, caddc, c3)
  diff.cfz.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c1, caddc, c3)
  diff.caddc.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s0, cv(s1), cmin, c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cmin.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm fsumshftd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → sum(s0 ∈(c0[...]c1), c2)= sum(s1 ∈((c0[+]c3)[...](c1[+]c3)), c4))
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ ℤ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0[...]c1))→ c2 ∈ ℂ)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 =(s1[-]c3))→ c2 = c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  syl5eq(sum(s0 ∈(c0[...]c1), c2), sum(s1 ∈((c0[+]c3)[...](c1[+]c3)), c4), sum(hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1),[hs0 / s0]c2), w0)
  cbvsumi(s0, hs0, (c0[...]c1), c2, [hs0 / s0]c2)
  nfcv(hs0, c2)
  eqtrd(sum(hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1),[hs0 / s0]c2), sum(s1 ∈((c0[+]c3)[...](c1[+]c3)), c4), sum(s1 ∈((c0[+]c3)[...](c1[+]c3)),[(s1[-]c3)/ s0]c2), w0)
  fsumshft(hs0, s1, c0, c1, [hs0 / s0]c2, c3, [(s1[-]c3)/ s0]c2, w0)
  chvar(s0, hs0, ((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1))→[hs0 / s0]c2 ∈ ℂ), ((w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0[...]c1))→ c2 ∈ ℂ))
  nfim(s0, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1)), [hs0 / s0]c2 ∈ ℂ)
  nfv(s0, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1)))
  nfel1(s0, [hs0 / s0]c2, cc)
  nfcsb1v(s0, hs0, c2)
  imbi12d(s0 = hs0, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈(c0[...]c1)), c2 ∈ ℂ, (w0 ∧ hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1)), [hs0 / s0]c2 ∈ ℂ)
  anbi2d(s0 = hs0, w0, s0 ∈(c0[...]c1), hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1))
  eleq1w(s0, hs0, (c0[...]c1))
  eleq1d(c2, cc, [hs0 / s0]c2, s0 = hs0)
  csbeq1a(s0, hs0, c2)
  csbeq1(s0, hs0, (s1[-]c3), c2)
  sumeq2sdv(s1, ((c0[+]c3)[...](c1[+]c3)), [(s1[-]c3)/ s0]c2, c4, w0)
  csbied(s0, (s1[-]c3), c2, c4, universe, w0)
  ovexd(s1, cmin, c3, w0)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[...]c1))
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c([(s1[-]c3)/ s0]c2)
  diff.csb.s(s1, s0, hs0, c2)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, w0, hs0 ∈(c0[...]c1))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, (c0[...]c1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cfz, c1)
  diff.cfz.s(s0)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s1, (c0[+]c3), cfz, (c1[+]c3))
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, caddc, c3)
  diff.cfz.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c1, caddc, c3)
  diff.caddc.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s0, s1, cmin, c3)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cmin.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: ax-riotaBAD
blocks.content: Define restricted description binder. In case it doesn't exist, we return a set which is not a member of the domain of discourse ` A ` . See also comments for ~ df-iota . (Contributed by NM, 15-Sep-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.) blocks.name: riotaclbgBAD
blocks.content: Closure of restricted iota. (Contributed by NM, 28-Feb-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm riotaclbgBAD(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wreu(s0, c0, w0), wcel(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbid2(wcel(c0, c1), wreu(s0, c0, w0), wcel(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0))
  riotacl(s0, c0, w0)
  con4d(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0), wreu(s0, c0, w0))
  syl5ibrcom(wcel(c0, c1), wn(wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wn(wcel(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0)), wn(wcel(cfv(cund, c0), c0)))
  undefnel2(c0, c1)
  notbid(wn(wreu(s0, c0, w0)), wcel(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0), wcel(cfv(cund, c0), c0))
  eleq1d(crio(s0, c0, w0), c0, cfv(cund, c0), wn(wreu(s0, c0, w0)))
  3eqtr4g(crio(s0, c0, w0), cfv(cund, c0), cif(cio(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cfv(cund, cab(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wreu(s0, c0, w0)), cfv(cund, cab(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wn(wreu(s0, c0, w0)))
  iffalse(cio(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cfv(cund, cab(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))), wreu(s0, c0, w0))
  ax-riotaBAD(s0, c0, w0)
  fveq2i(cund, c0, cab(s0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  abid1(s0, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm riotaclbgBAD(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →(∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0)↔ iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0)∈ c0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbid2(c0 ∈ c1, ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0), iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0)∈ c0)
  riotacl(s0, c0, w0)
  con4d(c0 ∈ c1, iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0)∈ c0, ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  syl5ibrcom(c0 ∈ c1, ¬ ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0), ¬ iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0)∈ c0, ¬(Undef ` c0)∈ c0)
  undefnel2(c0, c1)
  notbid(¬ ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0), iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0)∈ c0, (Undef ` c0)∈ c0)
  eleq1d(iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0), c0, (Undef ` c0), ¬ ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  3eqtr4g(iota(s0 ∈ c0, w0), (Undef ` c0), if(∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0), iota(s0,(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)),(Undef ` { s0 | s0 ∈ c0 })), (Undef ` { s0 | s0 ∈ c0 }), ¬ ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  iffalse(iota(s0,(s0 ∈ c0 ∧ w0)), (Undef ` { s0 | s0 ∈ c0 }), ∃!(s0 ∈ c0, w0))
  ax-riotaBAD(s0, c0, w0)
  fveq2i(cund, c0, { s0 | s0 ∈ c0 })
  abid1(s0, c0)
}

blocks.name: riotasvd
blocks.content: Deduction version of ~ riotasv . (Contributed by NM, 4-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm riotasvd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), w1), wceq(c3, c4)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c3, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c2, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s1), c4))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  sylibrd(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), w1), wceq(c3, c4), wceq(crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c2, wi(w1, wceq(cv(s1), c4)))), c4))

thm riotasv2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), wceq(c2, c3))
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wnfc(s0, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c5))))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6)), wb(w2, w1))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6)), wceq(c5, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c4))
  -| wi(w0, w1)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylan2(w0, wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c2, c3), wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  mp2and(wa(w0, wcel(c0, universe)), wceq(c2, c3), wcel(c6, c4), w1)
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), w1)
  vtocldf(s0, c6, c4, wa(w0, wcel(c0, universe)), wi(wa(wcel(c6, c4), w1), wceq(c2, c3)), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), w2), wceq(c2, c5)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c6, c4))
  adantlr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wceq(cv(s0), c6), wb(wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), w2), wceq(c2, c5)), wi(wa(wcel(c6, c4), w1), wceq(c2, c3))))
  imbi12d(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6)), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c4), w2), wceq(c2, c5), wa(wcel(c6, c4), w1), wceq(c2, c3))
  anbi12d(wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6)), wcel(cv(s0), c4), w2, wcel(c6, c4), w1)
  adantl(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6), wb(wcel(cv(s0), c4), wcel(c6, c4)))
  eleq1(cv(s0), c6, c4)
  eqeq2d(c2, c5, c3, wa(w0, wceq(cv(s0), c6)))
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c0, universe, c4, c2, c5, w0, w2)
  nfan(s0, w0, wcel(c0, universe))
  nfv(s0, wcel(c0, universe))
  nfcvd(s0, c6, wa(w0, wcel(c0, universe)))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wnf(s0, wi(wa(wcel(c6, c4), w1), wceq(c2, c3))))
  nfimd(s0, w0, wa(wcel(c6, c4), w1), wceq(c2, c3))
  nfand(s0, w0, wcel(c6, c4), w1)
  nfvd(s0, w0, wcel(c6, c4))
  nfeqd(s0, c2, c3, w0)
  mpbiri(w0, wnfc(s0, c2), wnfc(s0, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c5))))))
  nfriota(s0, s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c5))))
  nfra1(s0, c4, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c5)))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfceqdf(s0, c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c5)))), w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c6, c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm riotasv2d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)→ c2 = c3)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, c3))
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, w1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 = iota(s1 ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c4,(w2 → s1 = c5))))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 = c6)→(w2 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 = c6)→ c5 = c3)
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → w1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c5)
  ⊣ d(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylan2(w0, c0 ∈ c1, c2 = c3, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  elex(c0, c1)
  mp2and((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ 𝕌), c2 = c3, c6 ∈ c4, w1)
  adantr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, w1)
  vtocldf(s0, c6, c4, (w0 ∧ c0 ∈ 𝕌), ((c6 ∈ c4 ∧ w1)→ c2 = c3), ((s0 ∈ c4 ∧ w2)→ c2 = c5))
  adantr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, c6 ∈ c4)
  adantlr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, s0 = c6, (((s0 ∈ c4 ∧ w2)→ c2 = c5)↔((c6 ∈ c4 ∧ w1)→ c2 = c3)))
  imbi12d((w0 ∧ s0 = c6), (s0 ∈ c4 ∧ w2), c2 = c5, (c6 ∈ c4 ∧ w1), c2 = c3)
  anbi12d((w0 ∧ s0 = c6), s0 ∈ c4, w2, c6 ∈ c4, w1)
  adantl(w0, s0 = c6, (s0 ∈ c4 ↔ c6 ∈ c4))
  eleq1(s0, c6, c4)
  eqeq2d(c2, c5, c3, (w0 ∧ s0 = c6))
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c0, universe, c4, c2, c5, w0, w2)
  nfan(s0, w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  nfv(s0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  nfcvd(s0, c6, (w0 ∧ c0 ∈ 𝕌))
  adantr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, F/(s0,((c6 ∈ c4 ∧ w1)→ c2 = c3)))
  nfimd(s0, w0, (c6 ∈ c4 ∧ w1), c2 = c3)
  nfand(s0, w0, c6 ∈ c4, w1)
  nfvd(s0, w0, c6 ∈ c4)
  nfeqd(s0, c2, c3, w0)
  mpbiri(w0, F/(s0, c2), F/(s0, iota(s1 ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c4,(w2 → s1 = c5)))))
  nfriota(s0, s1, c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c4,(w2 → s1 = c5)))
  nfra1(s0, c4, (w2 → s1 = c5))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfceqdf(s0, c2, iota(s1 ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c4,(w2 → s1 = c5))), w0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c6, c4)
}

thm riotasv2s(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wceq(c2, csb(s0, c3, c5)))
  -| wceq(c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c5)))))

} = {

  3simpc(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  simp1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  riotasv2d(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, csb(s0, c3, c5), c4, c5, c3, wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wsbc(s0, c3, w0), w0)
  nfan(s0, wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  nfel1(s0, c2, c0)
  nfcxfr(s0, c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c5)))))
  nfriota(s0, s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c5))))
  nfra1(s0, c4, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c5)))
  nfcv(s0, c0)
  nfan(s0, wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))
  nfv(s0, wcel(c3, c4))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wnfc(s0, csb(s0, c3, c5)))
  nfcsb1v(s0, c3, c5)
  a1i(wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wnf(s0, wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  nfsbc1v(s0, c3, w0)
  a1i(wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wceq(c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c4, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c5))))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wceq(cv(s0), c3), wb(w0, wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  sbceq1a(s0, c3, w0)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))), wceq(cv(s0), c3), wceq(c5, csb(s0, c3, c5)))
  csbeq1a(s0, c3, c5)
  simpl(wcel(c2, c0), wa(wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0)))
  simprl(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))
  simprr(wcel(c2, c0), wcel(c3, c4), wsbc(s0, c3, w0))

blocks.name: riotasv
blocks.content: Value of description binder ` D ` for a single-valued class expression ` C ( y ) ` (as in e.g. ~ reusv2 ). Special case of ~ riota2f . (Contributed by NM, 26-Jan-2013.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 6-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm riotasv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2), w0), wceq(c0, c3))
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
  -| wceq(c0, crio(s1, c1, wral(s0, c2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c3)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  3impib(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(s0), c2), w0, wceq(c0, c3))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, c1), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), w0), wceq(c0, c3)), wcel(c1, universe))
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c1, universe, c2, c0, c3, wcel(c0, c1), w0)
  a1i(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(c0, crio(s1, c1, wral(s0, c2, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c3))))))
  id(wcel(c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm riotasv(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ s0 ∈ c2 ∧ w0)→ c0 = c3)
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c0 = iota(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(s0 ∈ c2,(w0 → s1 = c3)))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  3impib(c0 ∈ c1, s0 ∈ c2, w0, c0 = c3)
  mpan2(c0 ∈ c1, ((s0 ∈ c2 ∧ w0)→ c0 = c3), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c1, universe, c2, c0, c3, c0 ∈ c1, w0)
  a1i(c0 ∈ c1, c0 = iota(s1 ∈ c1, ∀(s0 ∈ c2,(w0 → s1 = c3))))
  id(c0 ∈ c1)
}

blocks.name: riotasv3d
blocks.content: A property ` ch ` holding for a representative of a single-valued class expression ` C ( y ) ` (see e.g. ~ reusv2 ) also holds for its description binder ` D ` (in the form of property ` th ` ). (Contributed by NM, 5-Mar-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm riotasv3d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(c0, c1)), w1)
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wi(w0, wnf(s0, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, crio(s1, c0, wral(s0, c3, wi(w2, wceq(cv(s1), c4))))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wceq(c4, c2)), wb(w3, w1))
  -| wi(w0, wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2), w3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wrex(s0, c3, w2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylan2(w0, wcel(c0, c1), w1, wcel(c0, universe))
  elex(c0, c1)
  mpd(wa(w0, wcel(c0, universe)), w1, wrex(s0, c3, w2))
  adantr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wrex(s0, c3, w2))
  imp(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wi(wrex(s0, c3, w2), w1))
  sylibd(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wi(wrex(s0, c3, w2), w1), wral(s0, c3, wi(w2, w1)))
  ralrimd(s0, c3, w0, wcel(c0, universe), wi(w2, w1))
  nfv(s0, wcel(c0, universe))
  exp45(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2, w1)
  mpbid(wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2))), w1, w3)
  adantrl(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2), w3)
  imp(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2), w3)
  syldan(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2)), wb(w3, w1), wceq(c4, c2))
  eqcomd(c4, c2, wa(w0, wa(wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2))))
  impr(w0, wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(cv(s0), c3), w2), wceq(c2, c4))
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c0, universe, c3, c2, c4, w0, w2)
  syl(w0, wb(wral(s0, c3, wi(w2, w1)), wi(wrex(s0, c3, w2), w1)), wnf(s0, w1))
  r19.23t(s0, c3, w1, w2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

thm riotasv3d(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  ⊢ ((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ c1)→ w1)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ (w0 → F/(s0, w1))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 = iota(s1 ∈ c0, ∀(s0 ∈ c3,(w2 → s1 = c4))))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ c4 = c2)→(w3 ↔ w1))
  ⊣ (w0 →((s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2)→ w3))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ (w0 → ∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylan2(w0, c0 ∈ c1, w1, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  elex(c0, c1)
  mpd((w0 ∧ c0 ∈ 𝕌), w1, ∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2))
  adantr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2))
  imp(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2)→ w1))
  sylibd(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2)→ w1), ∀(s0 ∈ c3,(w2 → w1)))
  ralrimd(s0, c3, w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (w2 → w1))
  nfv(s0, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  exp45(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, s0 ∈ c3, w2, w1)
  mpbid((w0 ∧(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧(s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2))), w1, w3)
  adantrl(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2), w3)
  imp(w0, (s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2), w3)
  syldan(w0, (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧(s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2)), (w3 ↔ w1), c4 = c2)
  eqcomd(c4, c2, (w0 ∧(c0 ∈ 𝕌 ∧(s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2))))
  impr(w0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (s0 ∈ c3 ∧ w2), c2 = c4)
  riotasvd(s0, s1, c0, universe, c3, c2, c4, w0, w2)
  syl(w0, (∀(s0 ∈ c3,(w2 → w1))↔(∃(s0 ∈ c3, w2)→ w1)), F/(s0, w1))
  r19.23t(s0, c3, w1, w2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}
